list-item.p: Chest computed tomography, without contrast: high sensitivity in identifying and quantifying lung parenchymal involvement. To be performed in every patient affected by lung involvement causing respiratory failure. Use of contrast only in case of specific clinical questions ( e.g. pulmonary embolism). The exam is required by the intensive care specialist in charge
Ecocardiography: indicated in case of suspected hearth failure as a contributing factor to lung involvement/respiratory failure
